DataElement.preferredName: Breast Atypical Or Benign Tissue Diagnosis Finding Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of the diagnosis for an atypical or benign index biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Atypical Or Benign Tissue Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Varying from the norm._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._(beh-NINE) Not cancerous; does not invade nearby tissue or spread to other parts of the body._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: Varying from the norm.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:(beh-NINE) Not cancerous; does not invade nearby tissue or spread to other parts of the body.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Varying from the norm; not conformable to the type.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

For neoplasms, a non-infiltrating and non-metastasizing neoplastic process that is characterized by the absence of morphologic features associated with malignancy (e.g., severe atypia, nuclear pleomorphism, tumor cell necrosis, and abnormal mitoses). For other conditions, a process that is mild in nature and not dangerous to health.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name of the diagnosis for an atypical or benign index biopsy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vo value exists.: (ep-ih-THEE-lee-ul) Refers to the cells that line the internal and external surfaces of the body.: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

Concepts.definition: Vo value exists.
A term that refers to the cells that make up the epithelial tissues.  They are found in the skin, and in the parenchyma, surface and lumen of internal organs.
The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A benign, borderline, or malignant fibroepithelial neoplasm arising from the breast and rarely the prostate gland.  It may recur following resection.  The recurrence rates are higher for borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors.  In borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors metastases to distant anatomic sites can occur.  The incidence of metastases is higher in malignant phyllodes tumors.

Concepts.definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant fibroepithelial neoplasm arising from the breast and rarely the prostate gland.  It may recur following resection.  The recurrence rates are higher for borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors.  In borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors metastases to distant anatomic sites can occur.  The incidence of metastases is higher in malignant phyllodes tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Varying from the norm.: Lobular; of or relating to or resembling a lobule.: An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

Concepts.definition: Varying from the norm; not conformable to the type.
Of or relating to or resembling a lobule.
An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This is the most common benign breast lesion.  It usually occurs in premenopausal women.  Diagnostic exams and procedures include: clinical exam, imaging (mammography and ultra sound), and tissue biopsy (fine-needle aspiration or core biopsy). -2002

Concepts.definition: A benign tumor of the breast characterized by the presence of stromal and epithelial elements. It presents as a painless, solitary, slow growing, firm, and mobile mass. It is the most common benign breast lesion. It usually occurs in women of childbearing age. The majority of fibroadenomas do not recur after complete excision. A slightly increased risk of developing cancer within fibroadenomas or in the breast tissue of patients previously treated for fibroadenomas has been reported.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Varying from the norm.: Ductal; related to, or having the quality of, a duct.: An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

Concepts.definition: Varying from the norm; not conformable to the type.
Related to, or having the quality of, a duct.
An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:The result of an examination or inquiry.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The result of an examination or inquiry.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
